meanings.definition: ゴニオニア（ギリシャ語由来の未確認/稀用語）
meanings.english_definition: Unverified term potentially related to angles or corners (from Greek 'gonia' meaning angle)
meanings.notes: This appears to be an extremely rare or potentially non-standard term. In medical/anatomical contexts, 'gonion' refers to the angle of the mandible.

etymology.value: Greek 'gonia' (γωνία) meaning 'angle, corner' + possibly suffix '-ia'. May be a constructed technical/scientific term.

notes: This term doesn't appear in major English dictionaries
Potential misspelling of 'gonion' (jaw angle) or 'gonia' (plural of gonion)
In biology, 'Gonionemus' is a genus of jellyfish

readability_explanation.text: This term appears to be either highly specialized, obsolete, or potentially non-existent in standard English usage. Without clearer context, its precise meaning cannot be determined.
